channel.title: Behance Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance

item.title: Sifang Art Museum
item.description: Set within the gentle terrain of Laoshan in Nanjing, the architecture of Sifang Art Museum is a well-constructed mix of harsh angularity with an elegant appeal whereby the asymmetrical structure hovers in space. Every view angle yielding a different trapezoidal perspective; the collateral system adopts the trapezoidal form. The Chinese saying - Strength within Gentleness - underpins the brand identity, describing the gentle landscape where in old China, scholars and artists took recluse to master their craft or refine their thinking. The demure that also balances the masculinity of the architecture. White, is also a canvas a museum would function as.
item.content:encoded: Set within the gentle terrain of Laoshan in Nanjing, the architecture of Sifang Art Museum is a well-constructed mix of harsh angularity with an elegant appeal whereby the asymmetrical structure hovers in space. Every view angle yielding a different trapezoidal perspective; the collateral system adopts the trapezoidal form. The Chinese saying - Strength within Gentleness - underpins the brand identity, describing the gentle landscape where in old China, scholars and artists took recluse to master their craft or refine their thinking. The demure that also balances the masculinity of the architecture. White, is also a canvas a museum would function as.

item.title: MRK: Prints
item.description: High quality prints available from MRK. MRK (Markos Kay) is a visual artist and design director based in London. Coming from a traditional Graphic Design and Fine Art background, he first became fascinated with 3D generative art during his Masters degree at Central St. Martins. His works have been exhibited internationally, while his video installation aDiatomea is a permanent exhibit at Haeckels Phyletic Museum in Germany. MRK's work fuses science with art, dealing with themes of emergence, evolution and complexity as well as virtuality and artificial life.
item.content:encoded: High quality prints available from MRK. MRK (Markos Kay) is a visual artist and design director based in London. Coming from a traditional Graphic Design and Fine Art background, he first became fascinated with 3D generative art during his Masters degree at Central St. Martins. His works have been exhibited internationally, while his video installation aDiatomea is a permanent exhibit at Haeckels Phyletic Museum in Germany. MRK's work fuses science with art, dealing with themes of emergence, evolution and complexity as well as virtuality and artificial life.

item.title: Nike London 2012 Retailer Hospitality
item.description: During the Olympics, Nike invites influential members indirect retail partners to attend the games as guests of the brand, hosting an event designed to showcase the latest Nike products, retail philosophies and innovative brand stories. The theme of the 2012 event was the crossroads of sport and digital, and feauted a digital retrofit of the beautiful One Marylabone Way event space, providing an amazing contrast between historic arcitecture with cutting-edge digital sport products and experiences. I created the brand identity and print collateral associated with the event, featuring a script-driven digital interpretation of the provided event logo, as well as contributing to spatial design and brand storytelling within the event space.
item.content:encoded: During the Olympics, Nike invites influential members indirect retail partners to attend the games as guests of the brand, hosting an event designed to showcase the latest Nike products, retail philosophies and innovative brand stories. The theme of the 2012 event was the crossroads of sport and digital, and feauted a digital retrofit of the beautiful One Marylabone Way event space, providing an amazing contrast between historic arcitecture with cutting-edge digital sport products and experiences. I created the brand identity and print collateral associated with the event, featuring a script-driven digital interpretation of the provided event logo, as well as contributing to spatial design and brand storytelling within the event space.

item.title: Rottet Studio Los Angeles
item.description: Rottet Studio Los Angeles, CA 9,600 SF Rottet Studios ultra-contemporary Los Angeles office occupies 9,600 square feet on the seventh floor of City National Plaza in the heart of downtown Los Angeles. The unique design is evident the moment the elevator doors open and you are greeted with bright white walls and geometric shapes that appear to be floating as if one is about to step onto a cloud. This illusion of floating walls is created by clever lighting design and this theme is carried throughout the space to provide guests with the impression they are in the clouds above the city. Playful transitions of intersecting planes are evident throughout the studio, which represent the ever-changing shape of cumulus clouds and the busyness of the interactive city streets below. Looking up in the space, white planes appear to softly float against the exposed, black-painted ceiling and light fixtures resemble stars on a dark night as if looking into a universe of endless negative space. To capture the essence of the creative exchange that accompanies an office studio, the design team emphasized open workstations to better promote communication and a democratic work environment. Moreover, these stations were positioned in the center of the space, beneath the exposed, black-painted ceiling to provide the employees with the impression of working beneath the stars and reminding them the sky is the limit.
item.content:encoded: Rottet Studio Los Angeles, CA 9,600 SF Rottet Studios ultra-contemporary Los Angeles office occupies 9,600 square feet on the seventh floor of City National Plaza in the heart of downtown Los Angeles. The unique design is evident the moment the elevator doors open and you are greeted with bright white walls and geometric shapes that appear to be floating as if one is about to step onto a cloud. This illusion of floating walls is created by clever lighting design and this theme is carried throughout the space to provide guests with the impression they are in the clouds above the city. Playful transitions of intersecting planes are evident throughout the studio, which represent the ever-changing shape of cumulus clouds and the busyness of the interactive city streets below. Looking up in the space, white planes appear to softly float against the exposed, black-painted ceiling and light fixtures resemble stars on a dark night as if looking into a universe of endless negative space. To capture the essence of the creative exchange that accompanies an office studio, the design team emphasized open workstations to better promote communication and a democratic work environment. Moreover, these stations were positioned in the center of the space, beneath the exposed, black-painted ceiling to provide the employees with the impression of working beneath the stars and reminding them the sky is the limit.

item.title: The Hangover Book
item.description: The expressions for 'hangover' vary greatly from country to country. In German the word translates as 'male cat'. In this brochure we introduced the world's 10 most famous 'male cats' using amusing stories, radical images and dubious household remedies.
item.content:encoded: The expressions for 'hangover' vary greatly from country to country. In German the word translates as 'male cat'. In this brochure we introduced the world's 10 most famous 'male cats' using amusing stories, radical images and dubious household remedies.

item.title: Shelton Slab
item.description: Shelton Slab is a Typeface with an eroded, printed look. The letters seem to be from different alphabets to support the wood type feeling. Every letter has an alternate character.
item.content:encoded: Shelton Slab is a Typeface with an eroded, printed look. The letters seem to be from different alphabets to support the wood type feeling. Every letter has an alternate character.

item.title: Cloud Experience
item.description: View webstite live at: www.cloud330experience.com Cloud Experience site seeks to promote engagement with LeaseWeb Extra 330LT plane. The idea was to let everyone have the chance to explore the atmosphere of aerobatic flight from their own computer. LeaseWeb is a company providing hosted infrastructure solutions, such as cloud, dedicated servers, colocation and more. Art Director / Visual Designer: Constantine Gavrykov Visual Designer: Evelien Gebler 3d Artist: Andrew Skliarow Developers: Sander Schouten, Dmitry Yaschenko Video Production: Worx Media
item.content:encoded: View webstite live at: www.cloud330experience.com Cloud Experience site seeks to promote engagement with LeaseWeb Extra 330LT plane. item.title: TCL - Led Tv
item.description: La reconocida agencia Argentina "La Comunidad" confió en Plenty para dirigir un proyecto súper interesante: el lanzamiento del nuevo LED Tv de TCL. La idea atrás del lanzamiento fue generar una familia de cinco personajes, el padre, la madre los dos hijos y su mascota. En dicha familia, el Padre será el verdugo de los planes de toda la familia al preferir comprar un LED Tv en vez de ir todos juntos a conocer la nieve, viajar a Orlando o reparar su propia casa! Los guiones son súper divertidos y nos encantó darle vida a esta familia que pronto vivirá nuevas aventuras!
item.content:encoded: La reconocida agencia Argentina "La Comunidad" confió en Plenty para dirigir un proyecto súper interesante: el lanzamiento del nuevo LED Tv de TCL. La idea atrás del lanzamiento fue generar una familia de cinco personajes, el padre, la madre los dos hijos y su mascota. En dicha familia, el Padre será el verdugo de los planes de toda la familia al preferir comprar un LED Tv en vez de ir todos juntos a conocer la nieve, viajar a Orlando o reparar su propia casa! Los guiones son súper divertidos y nos encantó darle vida a esta familia que pronto vivirá nuevas aventuras!

item.title: Prada Spring and Summer 2011 Show, Beijing
item.description: In January 2011 Miuccia Prada staged her first fashion show outside Milan at the Central Academy of Fine Arts Museum in Beijing. We collaborated with the internal Prada team to create and brand the event and transform the museum into distinctive spaces for a fashion show, dining room, concert hall, multiple bars and dance space for 1200 guests. We also created video projections, print materials, furniture, and online content specifically for the event and organized a special project with design students from CAFA to give the event a local footprint and to serve as a focal point for dialogue in the design community.
item.content:encoded: In January 2011 Miuccia Prada staged her first fashion show outside Milan at the Central Academy of Fine Arts Museum in Beijing. We collaborated with the internal Prada team to create and brand the event and transform the museum into distinctive spaces for a fashion show, dining room, concert hall, multiple bars and dance space for 1200 guests. We also created video projections, print materials, furniture, and online content specifically for the event and organized a special project with design students from CAFA to give the event a local footprint and to serve as a focal point for dialogue in the design community.

item.title: LOLA Magazine / Abril Editora
item.description: Editora Abril is headquartered in São Paulo, publishes 54 titles, with a circulation of 188,5 million copies, in a universe of nearly 28 million readers and 4.1 million signatures, the biggest of the segment in Latin America . LOLA magazine, one of these publications, offers compelling content and seeks to contemplate the multiplicity of readers interests. Shows styles, histories and profiles under a vision that denote unique angles. The text has depth and humor, with the tone of a inspirational magazine. The studio developed Pianofuzz illustrations for several editions of the magazine since its launch in 2010 until this year. Much of the work was done for the session Filosofia, where writers and personalities are invited to submit a chronic almost always reflective themed.
item.content:encoded: Editora Abril is headquartered in São Paulo, publishes 54 titles, with a circulation of 188,5 million copies, in a universe of nearly 28 million readers and 4.1 million signatures, the biggest of the segment in Latin America . LOLA magazine, one of these publications, offers compelling content and seeks to contemplate the multiplicity of readers interests. Shows styles, histories and profiles under a vision that denote unique angles. The text has depth and humor, with the tone of a inspirational magazine. The studio developed Pianofuzz illustrations for several editions of the magazine since its launch in 2010 until this year. Much of the work was done for the session Filosofia, where writers and personalities are invited to submit a chronic almost always reflective themed.

item.title: Slanted Magazine #20 Slab Serif
item.description: SLAB! Slanted Magazine #20 Slab Serif is entirely dedicated to the early 19th century born »serifenbetonte Linear-Antiqua,« broadly known as Egyptienne, Slab Serif, Square Serif or Mécanes outside German classification. Developing during Industrial Revolution in Great Britain, these typefaces fastly spread on advertising posters and flyers. Back in these days it was the main purpose of the slab serifs to attract attention by their strong visual expression. In this issue we want to bring back some of this (at least in Central Europe) rather gone attention to the often striking slab serifs.
item.content:encoded: SLAB! Slanted Magazine #20 Slab Serif is entirely dedicated to the early 19th century born »serifenbetonte Linear-Antiqua,« broadly known as Egyptienne, Slab Serif, Square Serif or Mécanes outside German classification. Developing during Industrial Revolution in Great Britain, these typefaces fastly spread on advertising posters and flyers. Back in these days it was the main purpose of the slab serifs to attract attention by their strong visual expression. In this issue we want to bring back some of this (at least in Central Europe) rather gone attention to the often striking slab serifs.

item.title: AU Digital Pioneers Issue
item.description: Building Brand Australia is the Australian Governments nation brand program represented by Australia Unlimited. The brand aims to build on the reputation held by Australias people, lifestyle and natural resources, and to promote its creative, economic and commercial credentials to a global audience. The Austalia Unlimited Ipad and Iphone apps are all about showcasing the work of Australias world class entrepreneurs, researchers, exporters, educators, designers, artists, administrators and humanitarians at home and around the world. From Google Australias Hurricane Sandy Crisis Response Team to start-ups like online shoe retailer Shoes of Prey, and music-based social network, Swarm.Fm, Australias digital pioneers are celebrated in the latest ipad issue, and the just launched, iPhone app launched by the Australian Government today. The AU (Australia Unlimited) app showcases 37 Australians who are shaping our digital future. The Australia Unlimited app is now available for iPhone (weekly) as well as iPad (monthly), and both formats can be downloaded for free from the App Store.
item.content:encoded: Building Brand Australia is the Australian Governments nation brand program represented by Australia Unlimited. The brand aims to build on the reputation held by Australias people, lifestyle and natural resources, and to promote its creative, economic and commercial credentials to a global audience. The Austalia Unlimited Ipad and Iphone apps are all about showcasing the work of Australias world class entrepreneurs, researchers, exporters, educators, designers, artists, administrators and humanitarians at home and around the world. From Google Australias Hurricane Sandy Crisis Response Team to start-ups like online shoe retailer Shoes of Prey, and music-based social network, Swarm.Fm, Australias digital pioneers are celebrated in the latest ipad issue, and the just launched, iPhone app launched by the Australian Government today. The AU (Australia Unlimited) app showcases 37 Australians who are shaping our digital future. The Australia Unlimited app is now available for iPhone (weekly) as well as iPad (monthly), and both formats can be downloaded for free from the App Store.

item.title: 35 FITEI Global project
item.description: 35º FITEI Briefing Pacifica seeks to develop every new edition of FITEI as a visual statement. This year we wanted to show an attitude of social responsibility. We developed the image of the 35th FITEI based on the following points: - Maximum visibility and originality. To create a moment that persists for a year. - Create a stimulating and flexible but consistent language. - Budget limitations: only 2 colors print. Concept The concept rises from the desconstruction of cheap and dispensable materials . Plastic Bag We chose the plastic bag as the main material. It is an analogy with current cultural Portuguese situation (no fundings, cheap culture) and the way culture unfortuantely tends to be undervalued and treated like a futility. - "Empty bag" or "full bag - popular expression that suits the intellectually intervention about the state of mind. Black Border The black border used to enphasize bad news on funeral letters or mourning states. This expression - the black border reinforces the serious message that FITEI and portuguese culture will mourn. Execution The plastic bag was explored throughout the communication materials including silkscreen and stamping, highlighting the plasticity and empowering the message. Real Mupi We build a full scale structure with the use of glass, plastic bags and fans that created a dynamic visual composition. The unpredictable behavior of the bag was photographed in many perspectives.
item.content:encoded: 35º FITEI Briefing Pacifica seeks to develop every new edition of FITEI as a visual statement. This year we wanted to show an attitude of social responsibility. We developed the image of the 35th FITEI based on the following points: - Maximum visibility and originality. To create a moment that persists for a year. - Create a stimulating and flexible but consistent language. - Budget limitations: only 2 colors print. Concept The concept rises from the desconstruction of cheap and dispensable materials . Plastic Bag We chose the plastic bag as the main material. It is an analogy with current cultural Portuguese situation (no fundings, cheap culture) and the way culture unfortuantely tends to be undervalued and treated like a futility. - "Empty bag" or "full bag - popular expression that suits the intellectually intervention about the state of mind. Black Border The black border used to enphasize bad news on funeral letters or mourning states. This expression - the black border reinforces the serious message that FITEI and portuguese culture will mourn. Execution The plastic bag was explored throughout the communication materials including silkscreen and stamping, highlighting the plasticity and empowering the message. Real Mupi We build a full scale structure with the use of glass, plastic bags and fans that created a dynamic visual composition. The unpredictable behavior of the bag was photographed in many perspectives.

item.title: Hugo Wolf Lied Lab
item.description: The Lied Lab 2010 Hugo Wolf Festival is a creative workshop bringing together the traditional songs of composer Hugo Wolf and contemporary visuals on five evenings. The design concept started with a typographical examination. The result is a font made of rather abstract geometric elements, almost similar to a stencilled lettering referring to musical tokens. Typography is applied to the invitation poster printed on translucent leightweight paper. The accompanying songbooks contain abstract illiustrations and colours in line with the five main topics. The DVD Packaging forms the title "Hugo Wolf" in either way combined. Project: Hugo Wolf Lied Lab Identity & DVD Packaging Year: 2010/11 Client: Departure Vienna At: Büro Bauer
item.content:encoded: The Lied Lab 2010 Hugo Wolf Festival is a creative workshop bringing together the traditional songs of composer Hugo Wolf and contemporary visuals on five evenings. The design concept started with a typographical examination. The result is a font made of rather abstract geometric elements, almost similar to a stencilled lettering referring to musical tokens. Typography is applied to the invitation poster printed on translucent leightweight paper. The accompanying songbooks contain abstract illiustrations and colours in line with the five main topics. The DVD Packaging forms the title "Hugo Wolf" in either way combined. Project: Hugo Wolf Lied Lab Identity & DVD Packaging Year: 2010/11 Client: Departure Vienna At: Büro Bauer

item.title: Bespoke
item.description: Every year the BASF Coatings GmbH invites main clients from the automotive industries to a presentation of the current Color Collection in form of a Color Show. For this event a special theme has to be conceived that always accords to the annual Global Trend Book Theme, which in 2012 was "WIDE AWAKE". For the annual workshop and Color Show 2012 all clients were invited to the Bespoke-Studio, where tailor-made color coatings were discussed and presented in a very special and classy atmosphere. Based on this concept invitations and additional event accessories like name badges ect. were handmade and customized on high class paper, refined with copper colored film plots and accurately fitting envelopes.
item.content:encoded: Every year the BASF Coatings GmbH invites main clients from the automotive industries to a presentation of the current Color Collection in form of a Color Show. For this event a special theme has to be conceived that always accords to the annual Global Trend Book Theme, which in 2012 was "WIDE AWAKE". For the annual workshop and Color Show 2012 all clients were invited to the Bespoke-Studio, where tailor-made color coatings were discussed and presented in a very special and classy atmosphere. Based on this concept invitations and additional event accessories like name badges ect. were handmade and customized on high class paper, refined with copper colored film plots and accurately fitting envelopes.

item.title: American Horror Story Asylum Main Title Sequence
item.description: American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy enlisted Kyle Cooper to direct a brand new title sequence for American Horror Story Season 2: Asylum. Prologue Films had the task of reinventing the sequence while retaining the same elusive horror from their titles in the first season. The Rennie Mackintosh typography and original score were preserved, while the visuals were filmed over two days on the American Horror Story set to match the insane asylum theme of Season 2. Disturbed mental patients and troubling scenes flash across the screen as Kyle Cooper gives us a peek inside the mysterious terror within the walls of the Asylum.
item.content:encoded: American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy enlisted Kyle Cooper to direct a brand new title sequence for American Horror Story Season 2: Asylum. Prologue Films had the task of reinventing the sequence while retaining the same elusive horror from their titles in the first season. The Rennie Mackintosh typography and original score were preserved, while the visuals were filmed over two days on the American Horror Story set to match the insane asylum theme of Season 2. Disturbed mental patients and troubling scenes flash across the screen as Kyle Cooper gives us a peek inside the mysterious terror within the walls of the Asylum.

item.title: LOGO DESIGN III
item.description: Selection of logos designed between 2011/12. A few of these were designed while working at VillarRosas BCN for such clients as Damm, Nike Europe, the Sonar Festival and Casa Tarradellas. Some of the logos were commissioned by Catch 24 New York and some others were commissioned by NIKE USA at Bowerman Drive in Oregon. The rest of the logos were designed for smaller yet equally exciting clients from several different cities.
item.content:encoded: Selection of logos designed between 2011/12. A few of these were designed while working at VillarRosas BCN for such clients as Damm, Nike Europe, the Sonar Festival and Casa Tarradellas. Some of the logos were commissioned by Catch 24 New York and some others were commissioned by NIKE USA at Bowerman Drive in Oregon. The rest of the logos were designed for smaller yet equally exciting clients from several different cities.
